availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Monarcha E. Luckett Taylor (Franklin County, KY, resident)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, resident. Daughter of Benjamin Luckett and Maria Luckett. Married to William K. Taylor. Mother of Richard Taylor, Maria Taylor, Ann Mary Taylor, and Bettie Taylor. Resident of Franklin County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Resident of Frankfort, Franklin County, in 1860. Owned one enslaved persons in Frankfort in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1, p. 13B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 1.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 253.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 491A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 18195.
